executive_summary: Tom Hayes discusses earnings season, the broadening market, and potential investment opportunities in small caps, China, and value stocks. He emphasizes the importance of low expectations and split government for market health. He also highlights the potential impact of a Trump presidency on small caps and Chinese stocks.

key_reasons: More central banks cut last month than have cut since 2020 and prior to that 2009
Market voting with liquidity and beating expectations so far

macro_thesis_summary: The market is in a mid-cycle of an 18-year secular bull market, driven by demographics (Millennials) and an easing cycle. Value will outperform growth. China and Emerging Markets offer the best value. A split government is good for the market.

key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: The market likes beating expectations. Looking out to 2025, you're looking at 15% earnings growth and margins are actually accelerating.
Bodes well for a manufacturing recovery.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: Private Client weekly outflow from T bills
Record inflow into Chinese Equity Funds

key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: More than enough. Wouldn't be surprised if the terminal rate is 4% not 3%.

BABA.thesis_summary: Baba is being added to the Hangsang family of indexes, forcing institutional buying.  It is a play on AI in China.  The Chinese government will jam so much liquidity into that market it is going to continue to go up in serious size in fits and starts.
BABA.action: Buy on dips, especially if it flushes down to 98. Reload on longer dated options.  What is David Tepper doing? The question is what are you doing?

BA.thesis_summary: Boeing won't go bankrupt.  The strike will be resolved soon.  The company has a massive backlog and is in a duopoly.  The company is in the stronger position relative to the union.
key_metrics: Hundreds of billions of dollars of sale of backlog
Tens of billions of free cash flow backlog
BA.action: Buy. If it won't go bankrupt, it's going to be a double over the next few years.

GXO.thesis_summary: GXO Logistics is exploring potential sales. A deal will be close to 80 or $85. The UK is having the most amount of economic surprises to the upside.
key_metrics: Potential takeover price of $85 per share
GXO.action: Hold.  Tom would prefer they didn't do a deal because he thinks it goes over a 100 over the next few years.

CRI.thesis_summary: Cooper Standard will benefit from increased auto production and a recovery in the auto industry.  The lower the price gets, the more incentives, the more volume we're going to see because the average car on the road is over 13 years old.
key_metrics: 150 bucks a car above 15.8 million SAR
CRI.action: Buy.  Tom is putting new clients in in Cooper standard at 13 bucks all day long.  The ones that have been with me for a while have it at five bucks and change but I think 13 bucks is like unbelievable.

actionable_ideas_ranked.idea: Buy Alibaba (BABA) on dips, especially if it flushes down to 98

risks_and_contrarian_flags: Year three of bull markets tend to be weaker
Potential for short-term consolidation in higher weighted companies
High Equity index valuations in the US market
technical_takeaways: High yield OAS spreads are close to record lows. The 10-year yield was a counter trend rally, the trend is down. The S&P broke out, maybe checking back or maybe goes straight up.
